title: Why do I have to use a number 2 pencil?

multiple-choice.question: What is the main reason why test instructions often tell students to use a number 2 pencil?

options.label: A
options.text: Because number 2 pencils are the most environmentally friendly option.

options.label: B
options.text: Because the graphite in number 2 pencils is electrically conductive.

options.label: C
options.text: Because number 2 pencils make marks that are just dark enough to be sensed by machines but also light enough to be erased without leaving a readable mark.

options.label: D
options.text: Because number 2 pencils are the cheapest option available.

options.label: C
options.text: A high school physics teacher named Thomas Edison

options.label: D
options.text: A group of researchers at a university

options.label: B
options.text: Because it is very hard and can make light marks.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it is electrically conductive and can block light.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it is very expensive and can only be used by a few people.

options.label: B
options.text: The softer the pencil, the darker the mark.

options.label: C
options.text: The harder the pencil, the lighter the mark.

options.label: D
options.text: The harder the pencil, the darker the mark.

options.label: A
options.text: Because number 2 pencils are the most environmentally friendly option.

options.label: B
options.text: Because number 2 pencils make marks that are just dark enough to be sensed by machines but also light enough to be erased without leaving a readable mark.

options.label: C
options.text: Because number 2 pencils are the cheapest option available.

options.label: D
options.text: Because number 2 pencils are the only type of pencil that can be used with modern scoring machines.

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Because they can control the amount of clay used.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they can control the way the graphite is held together by clay.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they can control the color of the pencil.

options.label: A
options.text: Because the numbers are a standard way of measuring the hardness of the graphite.

options.label: B
options.text: Because the numbers are a standard way of measuring the darkness of the mark.

options.label: C
options.text: Because the numbers are a way of differentiating between different types of pencils.

options.label: D

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Because they could only detect marks made with soft pencils.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they could only detect marks made with light pencils.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they could detect marks made with almost any type of pencil.

multiple-choice.question: What is the relationship between the type of pencil used and the type of sensor used in modern scoring machines?

options.label: A
options.text: The type of pencil used determines the type of sensor used.

options.label: B
options.text: The type of sensor used determines the type of pencil used.

options.label: C
options.text: The type of pencil used has no effect on the type of sensor used.

options.label: D
options.text: The type of sensor used has no effect on the type of pencil used.
